alert.note: Alert for Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 6:04PM CDT until August 22 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Val Verde. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Comstock, Juno, Langtry, Loma Alta, Shumla, Seminole Canyon State Park, Pandale, Pumpville, Bakers Crossing, Devils River State Nat Area Del Norte, Pecos River Boat Ramp, Devils River State Nat Area Big Satan, Pafford Crossing, Devils Shores and Vinegarone. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
